finding: The rs1893592 variant was recapitulated as an eQTL for UBASH3A associated with rheumatoid arthritis, confirming prior associations and enhancing its relevance.
title: Modeling memory T cell states at single-cell resolution identifies in vivo state-dependence of eQTLs influencing disease

finding: The SNP was found in the ABCG1 gene, which is crucial for lipid metabolism and cardiovascular health. Its selection indicated adaptations linked to changing dietary patterns and increases in cardiovascular disease prevalence.
title: 1,000 ancient genomes uncover 10,000 years of natural selection in Europe

finding: The SNP rs13050858 was associated with a specific phenotypic trait related to soybean yield and seed morphology. The context revealed that this SNP could influence the hundred-seed weight trait, as part of the study's comprehensive analysis on seed imaging and morphological evaluations. The methodological framework aimed at improving soybean cultivation through genetic insights, and the successful prediction models implied that genetic factors linked to this SNP were integral for developing high-yielding soybean cultivars.
title: A novel image-based approach for soybean seed phenotyping using machine learning techniques

finding: The SNP rs2251381 was reported with a GWAS association (P<sub>GWAS</sub> = 1.4E-06) associated with MAP3K7CL, which was confirmed in TWAS (P<sub>TWAS</sub> = 1.1E-09). This link indicated MAP3K7CL's relevance to OP and presented an avenue for further exploration.
title: Integrating genome-wide association and transcriptome predicted model identify novel target genes with osteoporosis

finding: The SNP rs11701974 was identified as a genetic variant of HLA-DQB1 associated with human longevity, and it was detected in the 3’ UTR of the ADAR2 gene. This SNP was specifically present in malignantly transformed cells, including BERP35T1 and BERP35T4 cell lines. The presence of rs11701974 and other SNPs related to the ADAR2 gene was correlated with the downregulation of ADAR2 enzymes, which in turn caused abnormal RNA editing patterns in the cancer cells analyzed.
title: Genome-wide identification and analysis of A-to-I RNA editing events in the malignantly transformed cell lines from BEP2D induced by α-particles radiation

finding: The SNP rs2835676 was associated with eQTL effects in colonic tissues, showing significant associations with both transverse and sigmoid colon tissues. This finding related to phenotypes of diverticular disease, specifically identified through a GWAS targeting diverticulosis.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome- and Phenome-wide Association Studies of Diverticular Disease in Electronic Health Records with Natural Language Processing enriched phenotype algorithm

finding: The variant rs883868 was identified as an expression-modulating variant that modulated the expression of UBASH3A by disrupting the binding of the transcription factor YY1. This finding was validated by an independent CRISPR/Cas experiment.
title: Computational Assessment of the Regulation-Modulating Potential for Noncoding Variants

finding: The SNP rs9980932 was found to have an important information flow related to the amyloid precursor protein (APP) gene, indicating its potential role in the development of Alzheimer's disease (AD) through its connection with peptide APP 3.
title: Deep multi-omic network fusion for marker discovery of Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs1981368 was also associated with significant informational flow related to the APP gene, suggesting its involvement in the transcription process that contributes to Alzheimer's disease mechanisms.
title: Deep multi-omic network fusion for marker discovery of Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This SNP was found to have a significant association with recurrent stones in nephrolithiasis patients.
title: GWAS identifies nine nephrolithiasis susceptibility loci related with metabolic metabolic and crystallization pathways

finding: The SNP rs2284553 colocalized with the IFNGR2 gene, which encodes the beta chain of the IFN-γ receptor. It was highlighted as a Crohn's disease-susceptibility variant, showing a higher minor allele frequency in the CEU population compared to the YRI population, indicating a signature of recent positive selection in the CEU.
title: Single-cell RNA-sequencing reveals pervasive but highly cell type-specific genetic ancestry effects on the response to viral infection

finding: The major (C) allele of the SNP rs2832407, a C-to-A non-coding intronic substitution in GRIK1, was associated with alcohol dependence. It was linked to neuronal activation in brain regions correlated with subjective alcohol craving and relapse risk in abstinent, alcohol-dependent individuals. Additionally, this SNP moderated responses to Topiramate (TPM) in treating alcohol use disorder, with reduced drinking observed only among GRIK1 rs2832407 CC homozygotes, who also demonstrated persistent reductions in heavy drinking following cessation of pharmacotherapy. Furthermore, in heavy drinkers, the CC genotype was associated with less severe TPM-induced adverse effects, suggesting that GluK1-containing kainate receptors (GluK1*KARs) play a significant role in both the risk of AUD and the treatment's efficacy.
title: Antagonism of GluK1-containing Kainate Receptors Reduces Ethanol Consumption by Modulating Ethanol Reward and Withdrawal

finding: Sufficiently, rs2839575 demonstrated genome-wide significant association in the Colombian trios for risk of orofacial clefts, with a p-value of 9.75e-09 and an odds ratio of 2.48 (95% CI = [1.81–3.45]), marking it as a crucial genetic factor specifically in the Colombian population.
title: Whole genome sequencing of orofacial cleft trios from the Gabriella Miller Kids First Pediatric Research Consortium identifies a new locus on chromosome 21

finding: This SNP was found to influence the expression of MAP3K7CL, confirmed by CRISPRi, resulting in a notable reduction in its gene expression levels.
title: Comprehensive identification of coronary artery disease-associated variants regulating vascular smooth muscle cell gene expression

finding: The variant rs13048049 (G>A) in UBASH3A was characterized as a protective missense variant with an odds ratio of 0.84 and is previously unreported in T1D studies.
title: Fine-mapping, trans-ancestral and genomic analyses identify causal variants, cells, genes and drug targets for type 1 diabetes

finding: Discovered that rs11088398 resided within a neuron-specific enhancer and was implicated in direct interactions with the DYRK1A promoter; it was predicted to strongly disrupt a PATZ1 transcription factor binding motif, supporting its significant role in PD.
title: Fine-mapping of Parkinson’s disease susceptibility loci identifies putative causal variants

finding: The lead SNP for IFNAR2, rs9636867, was shown to colocalize in CD4+ T cells of COVID-19 patients, indicating its association with hospitalization due to severe COVID-19. This SNP was previously linked to severe outcomes in other studies, affirming its critical role in the immune response.
title: Widespread gene-environment interactions shape the immune response to SARS-CoV-2 infection in hospitalized COVID-19 patients

finding: The rs2837990 variant demonstrated a significant genotype × age interaction for DNA methylation at the BACE2 locus. Specifically, it was observed that the 5mC levels decreased with age in individuals carrying the G>A allele of this SNP, highlighting its relevance to aging and potential implications for Alzheimer's disease.
title: The Immune Factors Driving DNA Methylation Variation in Human Blood

finding: The TMPRSS2 SNP rs12329760 was found to be protective against severe COVID-19 by impacting the enzyme's catalytic ability and its role in viral entry through the ACE2 receptor.
title: Semantic and population analysis of the genetic targets related to COVID-19 and its association with genes and diseases

finding: This SNP was located in an intron of the gene RUNX1 and exhibited significant association with MPN risk (joint p = 1.1 × 10^-9), implicating it as a variant that might affect HSC function.
title: Genetic predisposition to myeloproliferative neoplasms implicates hematopoietic stem cell biology

finding: The SNP rs2298515 was identified with the lowest univariate p-value of 5.6 x 10^-7, suggesting a strong association with radiation-associated contralateral breast cancer (RCBC). This finding indicated its potential relevance in predicting the risk of RCBC among the studied population.
title: Machine Learning Methods to Identify Genetic Correlates of Radiation-Associated Contralateral Breast Cancer in the WECARE Study

finding: The study identified that newborns carrying CG/CC genotypes of rs2257167 in IFNAR1 had a higher risk of developing Congenital Zika Syndrome (CZS), with an odds ratio of 3.73. This association was specifically noted after Zika infections during the second and third trimesters of pregnancy. The findings indicated that this SNP influenced placental gene expression, leading to an exacerbated type I interferon response which could contribute to CZS outcomes.
title: Congenital Zika Syndrome is associated with interferon alfa receptor 1

finding: The variant rs35074065 was significantly associated with TMPRSS2 expression in human lung samples (p=3.9×10^-11) and demonstrated high casual probability (PPA=41.6%) indicating a likely direct effect on TMPRSS2 expression. It disrupted the binding motifs of IRF and STAT transcription factors, suggesting a mechanism that might be involved in interferon signaling pathways relevant to respiratory function.
title: Single Nucleus Multiomic Profiling Reveals Age-Dynamic Regulation of Host Genes Associated with SARS-CoV-2 Infection

finding: The SNP rs7279188 showed nominal evidence of association with respiratory medication use, specifically salmeterol + fluticasone propionate, with a p-value of 1.3×10^-5, indicating a potential impact on treatments for respiratory conditions.
title: Single Nucleus Multiomic Profiling Reveals Age-Dynamic Regulation of Host Genes Associated with SARS-CoV-2 Infection

finding: The variant rs2838089 was associated with bacterial pneumonia, showing a nominal association with a p-value of 2.4×10^-4, implicating its potential role in respiratory infections.
title: Single Nucleus Multiomic Profiling Reveals Age-Dynamic Regulation of Host Genes Associated with SARS-CoV-2 Infection

finding: The SNP rs9974995 was significantly associated with bronchiectasis with a p-value of 7.1×10^-4, highlighting its relevance in respiratory pathology.
title: Single Nucleus Multiomic Profiling Reveals Age-Dynamic Regulation of Host Genes Associated with SARS-CoV-2 Infection

finding: The variant rs568517 was associated with bronchiectasis, yielding a nominal p-value of 8.1×10^-4, suggesting its influence on this respiratory condition.
title: Single Nucleus Multiomic Profiling Reveals Age-Dynamic Regulation of Host Genes Associated with SARS-CoV-2 Infection

finding: The rs1557372 variant showed significant association with COPD, with a nominal p-value of 2.9×10^-3, indicating its potential relevance in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.
title: Single Nucleus Multiomic Profiling Reveals Age-Dynamic Regulation of Host Genes Associated with SARS-CoV-2 Infection

finding: The rs200655253 variant was identified as a missense substitution in the HSF2BP gene, specifically altering the serine at position 167 to leucine (p.Ser167Leu). This variant was associated with Primary Ovarian Insufficiency (POI) in a consanguineous family, where three out of five daughters were affected. It exhibited a Mendelian inheritance pattern, being homozygous in the affected twin III-1 while both parents and fertile siblings were heterozygous carriers. Functional analyses indicated the variant acted as a hypomorphic allele, reducing fertility and litter sizes in mouse models. The rarity of this variant (VAF 0.0001845 in GnomAD) and its predicted pathogenicity by most predictors highlighted its potential role in non-syndromic ovarian insufficiency.
title: A missense in HSF2BP causing Primary Ovarian Insufficiency affects meiotic recombination by its novel interactor C19ORF57/MIDAP

finding: The SNP rs13051095 was associated with the study that linked diet-induced changes in liver fat to an increased risk of cancer, particularly hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) in mice. This was contextualized in the examination of how B domain-deleted FVIII (BDD-FVIII) expression contributed to liver tumor development, with a specific focus on how different diets, like a high-fat diet (HFD), promoted these effects.
title: Ectopic FVIII expression and misfolding in hepatocytes as a potential cause of human hepatocellular carcinoma

finding: The SNP rs13050728 was found to have significant associations with COVID-19 severity, with the T allele identified as a risk allele. This SNP was linked to a unique splicing QTL effect that contributed to the expression of novel transcripts in monocytes/macrophages. Patients with the T/T genotype had higher expression of these transcripts, correlating with increased COVID-19 infectivity and severity.
title: CiDRE+ M2c macrophages hijacked by SARS-CoV-2 cause COVID-19 severity

finding: Colocalization analysis identified rs398206 as a common causal variant for eQTL, meQTL, and melanoma risk at the locus near <italic>MX2</italic>. Higher levels of methylation were correlated with the allele associated with increased <italic>MX2</italic> expression.
title: Cell-type-specific meQTL extends melanoma GWAS annotation beyond eQTL and informs melanocyte gene regulatory mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs183453668 was part of the significant findings on chromosome 21 for recurrent miscarriage with a MAF of 0.5% and a P-value of 2.8×10^-8. It was the lead signal, supported by chromatin interaction data suggesting involvement of various candidate genes.
title: The genetic architecture of sporadic and recurrent miscarriage

finding: RS398206 was identified as a functional cis-regulatory variant impacting the expression of the MX2 gene in melanocytes. The A allele of rs398206 was shown to mediate higher MX2 levels, linking increased expression to melanoma risk. This variant displayed significant allelic transcriptional activity and was preferentially bound by the transcription factor YY1, demonstrating a crucial regulatory mechanism at the 21q22.3 melanoma susceptibility locus.
title: Massively parallel reporter assays combined with cell-type specific eQTL informed multiple melanoma loci and identified a pleiotropic function of HIV-1 restriction gene, MX2, in melanoma promotion

finding: The rs2249666 sQTL was found to colocalize with a total joint replacement (TJR) GWAS signal (index variant rs9981884). This association was specific to the PBS condition, indicating a significant impact on splicing and possibly driving OA risk related to the HMGN1 gene.
title: Response splicing QTLs in primary human chondrocytes identifies putative osteoarthritis risk genes

finding: The GWAS signal at index variant rs9981884 was connected with the sQTL rs2249666 influencing the splice junction involved in total joint replacement phenotypes, specifically in the context of osteoarthritis.
title: Response splicing QTLs in primary human chondrocytes identifies putative osteoarthritis risk genes

finding: The SNP rs13051037 was associated with increased anti-tumor immunity specifically in renal cell carcinoma tumors that harbored 14q deletions. This finding was corroborated by previously published data from single-cell RNA sequencing, indicating its relevance in understanding immune evasion mechanisms in tumors and thereby contributing to precision immuno-oncology.
title: RIGATonI: An R software for Rapid Identification of Genomic Alterations in Tumors affecting lymphocyte Infiltration

finding: The rs148125094 SNP (V415I) was identified as the most frequently sampled SNP with an allele frequency of 1.1x10^-3. This SNP led to reduced but detectable binding of the HKU1 S glycoprotein to the HKU1 isolate N1 receptor binding domain (RBD) when compared to wildtype human TMPRSS2, indicating a potential impact on receptor engagement.
title: Human coronavirus HKU1 recognition of the TMPRSS2 host receptor

finding: The rs2146419758 SNP (S463F) was reported to abrogate binding to the wildtype HKU1 RBD. This finding was supported by structural analysis, which indicated that no energetically favored phenylalanine side chain rotamers at this position were sterically compatible with the binding interface identified in the cryo-electron microscopy structure, suggesting a significant impact on HKU1 receptor attachment.
title: Human coronavirus HKU1 recognition of the TMPRSS2 host receptor

finding: The SNP showed good representation in allele frequencies contributing to its good standing in forensic applications.
title: The forensic landscape and the population genetic analyses of Hainan Li based on massively parallel sequencing DNA profiling

finding: At the inflammatory bowel disease (IBD)-associated locus, rs1736137 was reported to have significant expression-modulating activity in both resting and stimulated T cells. Specifically, the IBD-risk allele consistently increased transcription, indicating its role in the pathogenesis of IBD.
title: Resolving mechanisms of immune-mediated disease in primary CD4 T cells

finding: The rs59515793 SNP, located in an intergenic region on 21q21.1, was associated with pallidum volume variance. It explained 0.405% of the variance in this brain structure, with a significant p-value of 2.4×10^-11. The finding was robust, even when analyzing data from healthy controls.
title: Genetic control of variability in subcortical and intracranial volumes

finding: This specific SNP at chr21:21977114:G:A, representing the same variant as rs59515793, demonstrated the same significant association with pallidum volume variance.
title: Genetic control of variability in subcortical and intracranial volumes

finding: The SNP rs13051118 was associated with the regulation of the mTOR pathway in the context of chemoresistance in pancreatic cancer cells. The research indicated that variations at this locus could affect chemosensitivity by either promoting or inhibiting the persistence of drug-tolerant tumors, thus relating to patient survival outcomes in various human cancers.
title: mTOR is a Major Determinant of Chemosensitivity

finding: The analysis demonstrated that the delC variant (rs35074065) of the TMPRSS2 gene was common in populations in Europe, America, and South Asia, but extremely rare in East Asia. This variation was linked to an increased functional advantage concerning the D614G mutation of the SARS-CoV-2 virus, leading to its spread, particularly in Europe and America, and its recent emergence in South Asia.
title: Molecular characterization of SARS-CoV-2 from Bangladesh: Implications in genetic diversity, possible origin of the virus, and functional significance of the mutations

finding: In the publication by Klink et al. (2021), rs13051127 was identified as significant in the mechanistic exploration of therapeutic efficacy regarding the CK2 inhibitor CX-4945 in AML. This study emphasized how the inhibitor's effects on CK2 activity played a crucial role in therapeutic strategies for AML.
title: Targeting of Protein Kinase CK2 in Acute Myeloid Leukemia Cells Using the Clinical-Grade Synthetic-Peptide CIGB-300

finding: The variant rs12329760, a C to T mutation at position 589, led to a change from valine to methionine at amino acid position 197 in TMPRSS2. It was previously associated with increased risk for prostate cancer in European and Indian populations and was found to have a frequency ranging from 10% to 63% across various human populations, with significantly higher frequencies observed in populations of East Asian origin.
title: Structural variability, expression profile and pharmacogenetics properties of TMPRSS2 gene as a potential target for COVID-19 therapy

finding: This SNP was implicated in inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) through its association with CpG cg19297788, demonstrating genetic overlap with the ICOSLG gene, a known IBD risk factor.
title: Genetic impacts on DNA methylation help elucidate regulatory genomic processes

finding: The variant with the G allele at residue 38 (p.S38G, rs1805127) was highlighted for its high global allele frequency (65.8% across ancestral populations). This variant was part of the used KCNE1 sequence in the study, indicating its relevance and possible functional implications in relation to cardiac channel biology.
title: High-throughput functional mapping of variants in an arrhythmia gene, KCNE1, reveals novel biology

finding: The rs2248244 variant was identified as a PD risk variant through conditional analysis statistics, highlighting its association with Parkinson's disease. This finding contributed to the understanding of genetic variations influencing PD susceptibility.
title: The IPDGC/GP2 Hackathon - an open science event for training in data science, genomics, and collaboration using Parkinson’s disease data

finding: A significant positive association was found between the rs2070788 SNP (G allele) and the case fatality rate (CFR) in India, indicating that higher frequencies of the G allele correlated with increased CFR among different Indian populations. This SNP was associated with higher expression of TMPRSS2 in the lungs of individuals with the GG genotype compared to those with AG and AA genotypes, suggesting a connection to severe outcomes in SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: Genetic association of TMPRSS2 rs2070788 polymorphism with COVID-19 Case Fatality Rate among Indian populations

finding: The SNP rs34217534 exhibited associations with the lincRNA LINC00936, associated with monocyte differentiation, in CD14+ monocytes.
title: Expression QTLs in single-cell sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs2826196 was also associated with the lincRNA LINC00936 in CD14+ monocytes, highlighting its relevance in genetic regulation.
title: Expression QTLs in single-cell sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs2070424 of the SOD1 gene was identified as being associated with an increased risk of Alzheimer's disease. This finding contributed to understanding the genetic factors that may underlie Alzheimer's disease mechanisms.
title: A Meta-Analysis of Alzheimer’s Disease Brain Transcriptomic Data

finding: The SNP rs449998, an intronic variant located in the Down Syndrome Cell Adhesion Molecule (DSCAM) gene on chromosome 21, was linked to changes in nucleus accumbens volume. DSCAM is involved in the development of both the central and peripheral nervous systems.
title: Dynamics of Brain Structure and its Genetic Architecture over the Lifespan

finding: In the study by Holbrook et al. (2021), the SNP rs13051171 was associated with pancreatic cancers responsive to vesicular stomatitis virus-based oncolytic virotherapy. The finding indicated that this SNP may play a critical role in influencing how effectively certain pancreatic cancers could respond to this type of viral treatment, thus highlighting its relevance in the context of cancer therapy and viral interactions.
title: Bacterial Effector Screening Reveals RNF214 as a Virus Restriction Factor in Mammals

finding: The N109S SNP caused a mutation in the RUNX1 gene where Asparagine mutated into Serine at position 109. This change was recognized as potentially damaging to protein structure and function, contributing to the pathogenesis of acute myeloid leukemia (AML).
title: Six novel nsSNPs affect RUNX1 gene may leading to Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML) using Bioinformatics approach

finding: The N109S SNP led to a mutation in the RUNX1 gene where Asparagine mutated into Histidine at position 109. This alteration was identified as damaging to protein structure, which may be implicated in the development of AML.
title: Six novel nsSNPs affect RUNX1 gene may leading to Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML) using Bioinformatics approach

finding: The L144P SNP resulted in a mutation where Leucine mutated into Proline at position 144 in the RUNX1 gene. This change was characterized as harmful to protein structure and function, supporting its role in AML pathogenesis.
title: Six novel nsSNPs affect RUNX1 gene may leading to Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML) using Bioinformatics approach

finding: The V155A SNP led to a mutation where Valine was replaced by Alanine at position 155 in the RUNX1 gene. This modification was found to adversely affect protein structure, potentially contributing to AML.
title: Six novel nsSNPs affect RUNX1 gene may leading to Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML) using Bioinformatics approach

finding: The G165S SNP caused a Glycine to Serine mutation at position 165 in the RUNX1 gene. This change was determined to be damaging, with implications for protein function related to AML.
title: Six novel nsSNPs affect RUNX1 gene may leading to Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML) using Bioinformatics approach

finding: The Y285C SNP resulted in a mutation where Tyrosine was substituted by Cysteine at position 285 in the RUNX1 gene. This alteration was shown to likely disrupt protein integrity, which could lead to the onset of AML.
title: Six novel nsSNPs affect RUNX1 gene may leading to Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML) using Bioinformatics approach

finding: The KCNJ15 rs3746876 genetic variant was replicated as being associated with susceptibility to type 2 diabetes in a Japanese population, further confirming its potential impact on diabetes risk.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The SNP rs13051118 was associated with drug resistance mechanisms in cancer therapies. It was identified in the context of a study that focused on the overactivation of the MAPK pathway in various cancers including lung, breast, and melanoma. The presence of this SNP appeared to correlate with the dynamic regulation of RAS mRNAs and their role in promoting drug tolerance, specifically in relation to the effects of MEK inhibitors (MEKi). The findings suggested that rs13051118 could be a marker of how cancer cells adapt to treatments by modulating protein levels that impact MAPK signaling.
title: Processing body dynamics drive non-genetic MEK inhibitors tolerance by fine-tuning KRAS and NRAS translation

finding: The cis-eQTL (rs1893592) for UBASH3A in resting T cells colocalised with GWAS signals for celiac disease, rheumatoid arthritis, and primary sclerosing cholangitis, indicating its involvement in autoimmune pathways.
title: Neonatal genetics of gene expression reveal the origins of autoimmune and allergic disease risk

finding: The SNP rs1059004 associated with the OLIG2 gene was linked to negative self-schema traits in individuals predisposed to depression, highlighting its psychological impacts.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs469390 in the MX1 gene was associated with HIV total DNA in the European ancestry male subpopulation. The association was positive, and eQTL analyses suggested a direct relationship between MX1 gene expression and HIV reservoir size. This indicates that variations in the MX1 gene may play a role in the HIV reservoir's dynamics.
title: Host Variation in Interferon, MHC Class I, Glycosylation, and Viral Transcription Genes Predict HIV Persistence
